ratings.comment:
I just finished taking Stat 310, and I am shocked to see these low reviews. I thought he was great!

Keith motivates every mathematical concept before getting into the theory (few professors do this), and he gives great explanations.

Stat 310 may be in the Stats department, but it is a math class. Don't hate the prof cause you don't like math.

Keith strikes me as a passionate researcher who shouldn't be a professor. His lectures are uninformative, the homeworks are long but not useful for exam prep (and were also taken straight from some Ann Arbor course), and the exams were quite challenging with no solutions posted. His jokes are less endearing when he makes the class such a pain.

Homeworks were long but worth very little and only partially graded. Exams were intense but curved a lot because of difficulty. Difficult and overwhelming to prepare for the exams and Keith emphasizes that he does not have a lot of time to help students.

Be prepared to read. A lot. Levin's lectures are simply an ineffective teaching method and rarely correlate to the exam content. He has been the most inefficient and useless professor I have had the displeasure of learning under at this school. I would highly recommend taking this course or any other under literally any other professor.
Honestly he's not bad at lecturing, he just gets stuck teaching tough classes. His jokes were cringey at first but it's endearing. Get ready to work and you'll be fine, he's helpful and a nice guy.
UW Madison Stat department has really good teachers, especially him.

Undisputedly the worst professor I've had. Lectures do not correlate at all to the exams. Exams are worth 90% of grade and only "review" material given for exams is him telling you to re-look at your homework. Mean scores for the exams were consistently

AVIOD. Really had a hard time in this class. The HW problems are copied eighter from Michigan-Ann Arbor, or from this class taught from 2019. There is a big mismatch between in-class materials, HW, and exam. Keith is not patient when meeting students in office hour, and his lecture is unclear -- I could only come to TA OH for asking questions.

Worst teacher I've ever had. In the least cocky way I'm pretty friggin smart and I have coasted by 4 years at this university with a 3.75 gpa and MINIMAL effort. This class has been the COMPLETE opposite. DO NOT TAKE STAT 310 WITH THIS MAN. He teaches as if it is a graduate course and expects you to know way more than intro classes teach.

YOU WANT ME TO SAY IT AGAIN, BUT LOUDER?

Keith gets sh*t on a lot, but he isn't a bad professor, per se. He just lacks communication skills. His classes aren't too bad. But most people tend to have more issues with him than I did.
Not a good idea to take his lecture if you have other options.

His class is one of the top ten tortures in American history. He is generated by AI, you will only have a fixed answer with anything you asked, less polite than AI. He and his pet dog grader (i.e green turtle) vents their resentment towards the world on the students. I paid $4800 to come to this class and get someone to torture me.A piece of dabian

This review is for  STAT 606. I think he does a great job at teaching Python! There are no exams, quizzes or projects in the class. Your grade is based entirely on HWs which can be long but you have almost 10 days to work on it.  I would definitely recommend taking this class if you have a weak background in Python.

Honestly didn't think he was that bad contrary to the rest of the reviews on here. I would say as a professor he's average and I didn't think his lectures were too bad. As far as grading goes I would go with someone else. Keith's class is historically much harder than the other professors that teach this course.

Keith is a nice guy, but not the greatest lecturer. He reads from his notes that are usually too surface level to be useful on exams. The homeworks are also not very useful, as they are light on content to likely make them easier to grade. Exams are worth 90% of your grade, but at least they're online and open note, still they're overly difficult.

Keith was an avg professor. Not the worst, not the best. Don't agree with everyone saying he's nightmarish. He's pretty mid. Keith tries to be funny (at least he tries). But he repeats himself too much. Exams are worth SO much of your grade, but they echo the HWs. Lectures are boring, but I went anyways--could often finish the HW in that time.
One thing that I hate most is the unnecessarily wordy in all lecture notes, homeworks, discussions and exam papers. Those things make students so confused

Stupid professor. Did not provide any helpful suggestions or feedback. No answers for homework and midterms. No comments on points lost. Useless lectures. Don't take it.
However, he looks good.

Study guides and homeworks do not prepare you for the exams. Exams are three hours long, but you barely have enough time to finish them. Exams are worth 90% of your grade yet homework is only worth 10% which I think is unfair.

Exams are weighted heavily. I spent hours on homework, yet they hardly influenced grade. Lectures are dry and equation heavy and he makes you feel dumb. To quote him, "Skipping class is the bestcase scenario. I get to work on research." Obvious contempt for the field of teaching and complains about his salary and when you don't laugh at his jokes.
bad professor
Worst professor I have ever had in my four years in college
Why does he made this class so hard while the previous semesters the professors made it much easier???

Keith is a straight up an example of what it means to be an illiterate professor. After explicitly stating what the exam would look like, he is not ashamed of f*** up students. He will not even let you re-grade your home-works if they are graded incorrectly. He degrades the quality of professors that UW-M lives upto. HIGHLY ILLITERATE PROFESSOR!

Professor Levin is really chill if you get to know him and he is very passionate about the subject materials. Exams are difficult but he is willing to help you understand what you aren't understanding.

Keith repeats the same few phrases at least once a lecture. His lectures are somewhat helpful, but he spends too much time re-explaining concepts making them more difficult. I think he is really smart but just cannot teach it well. He does read from the slides sometimes and often adds complicated math to the lectures.
It is really annoying how he made the class EXTREMELY HARD and at the same time HE DOES NOT KNOW HOW TO TEACH!

Very tough grader and when you ask him questions he is really impatient and very unfriendly. He is really bad at lecturing and read off directly from slides. I did not learn anything from this terrible course!!!!
I'M NEW HERE, ARE YOU BORED OR CONFUSED??? OH SORRY, SHOULD I SAY THE SAME THING BUT LOUDER!?!? Really bad at lecturing, and says the same thing mentioned above over and over and over.
He was just fxxking crazy and shit
Teaching style is great. I do get distracted occasionally during every lecture, but the professor will repeat what he said sometimes and personally it's quite helpful.
Confused face or bored face or laptop face? Why not all 3!? Please say it again but louder!
This professor says no regrade will be offered because there are lots of students. This is also the case when they made a mistake during grading, regrade will still not be offered.

Same as other comments. I had a really bad office-hour experience because he sounded really rude. He also graded the final project arbitrarily without even reading the report carefully. Grade cut-off is not clear. Avoid at all costs.

Don't take his class. He grades everything based on his subjective opinions, doesn't even care what you have done. And yet the entire class still doesn't know the grade cutoff for this class. Just avoid him.

Just don't do it. This guy leaves you with a huge open ended final to end the class and just screws you over with no guidance, and then takes off huge points when you don't understand what he wants. Absolute joke of a professor, steer clear from this guy if you actually want a professor you can respect. Pathetic effort at teaching by Keith.

This is LITERALLY the WORST lecturer I have ever had at UW-Madison. He is so uncaring and subjective. He only gives you credit if you do exactly as he wants and includes the exact things he thinks of, which is impossible because he is an experienced statistician and we are obviously not. Avoid him at all costs, he will ruin your day everyday.

No piazza just make this course even harder. You don't want to wait long time during office hour :) The instruction and requirement for final project is also vague. Get ready to struggle and spend lots of time at office hour. And the most hilarious thing is that since this course is co-taught, you might receive opposite opinions from two lecturers.

I feel very unhappy taking his class. He gave harsh comment on homework. I know I did wrong, and I totally accept comment like "completely wrong". But please could you provide any helpful explanations? Receiving zero for a problem and only getting a comment of "completely wrong" is just meaningless.

Keith always grades things toughly. He can't provide clear instruction and rubric for the final project, which is worth 30% of the final grade. Lectures are kinda boring, so I end up reading all lecture notes by myself. Some homework questions are far beyond what we learned from lectures. Don't feel this class is useful.
Terrible instructer. Never gives anything useful. Rude and disrepectful

The most unhelpful professor I have ever had. He does not communicate well, and his grading is super unclear. Midterm and project progress reports were not graded even a week before the final due date and the final.

Keith tries his best. He provides lecture notes, which are extremely detailed and comprehensive, and is not a very engaging lecturer. I've found lectures to be basically useless, discussion is optional but I definitely regret not going. I have no idea what my grade will be, and it is based on 5 HW assignments, 2 exams, and 1 group project.

His lecture is okay, a little bit dry, but he wrote good notes, which is very useful to me. However, the class is terribly structured in me opinion, no piazza, no discord, and the group project is just confusing, I have no idea what is he expecting, he didn't much dataset in class, and there are no example project.

Keith is a good professor, his homework is reasonable, he stays on track during lecture, and I personally have never had issues with him during office hours. He is very blunt when answering questions which can be mistaken as him being rude but he is just trying to get straight to the point and let you know there are no trick questions.
DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS. HE DOES NOT CARE ABOUT HIS STUDENTS.

Just like the first rating below, had really bad experience at his office hour. DON'T take his class unless you're smart and high IQ. He makes you feel that your questions are meaningless and is wasting his time, though office hours are to solve students' problems.

He is rude and unreachable. I had questions from my exam. So, I went to his office hour, waited for half hour just for a short explanation. He told me there are so many people waiting outside for more important questions, started to yell at me, and looked at me with impatience. I left the office hour without asking the other more important question
